Author: mroman
Content:
Well, if you "love to read beautiful and meaningful HTML" why does your site http://prezentit.com/ have HTML errors?

First one is on line 34. An end tag isn't finished . . . there are several more, and I am not even a web designer.

That's a lot of nerve, criticizing the work of others, while not getting your own done right.

Author: bayareaguy
Content:
This is an unexpected failure mode from Google:

- http://i256.photobucket.com/albums/hh191/GoogleTransit/Googl...

I told it I wanted to get to Sacramento by 8pm this evening (14 hours from now). I'm suprised it didn't offer any alternatives or at least be more honest and say it doesn't know anything about that origin or destination.

Author: mixmax
Content:
I believe that the IRS uses Benfords law for fraud detection. If the numbers on your tax return do not conform to the law they will investigate further, as there is a good chance that you made the numbers up.

Maybe there is a potential start-up idea in generating and selling credible numbers that will fit Benfords law for creating fraudulent tax returns ;-)

Author: rams
Content: Webdav is really one of the really ugly design decisions of the Subversion project. WebDAV was initially promoted by Rational - if you closely study WebDAV, it is easy to notice similarities with Clearcase. Looks like it was a political choice that was made to appeal to the managers in the IT departments - "Oh, Firewalls are not a problem, If your browser works, then the SVN should work ... blah blah". To be fair though some of the top committers will freely confess to a dislike for WebDAV.
